branches.name: feature/weighted-edits
branches.rationale: To enhance similarity scoring by allowing certain character substitutions to count differently in edit distance calculations.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_weights method
commits.body: Added a new method to calculate edit distance with weighted character substitutions.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_weights function to handle weighted edits.

commits.title: Expose distance_with_weights in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new method in the public API.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_weights to the module exports.

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_weights
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new method.

branches.name: feature/max-distance-cutoff
branches.rationale: To improve performance by allowing the distance method to return early for inputs exceeding a specified threshold.

src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Expose distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) in the API
docs/levenshtein.rst: Update documentation for distance with max distance option

risk_notes: Ensure backward compatibility with existing distance method.

commits.title: Implement distance with max distance option
commits.body: Added a new method to calculate edit distance with a maximum distance cutoff.

commits.title: Expose distance with max distance in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new method in the public API.
per_file_changes: Added distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) to the module exports.

commits.title: Update documentation for distance with max distance
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new method.
per_file_changes: Added documentation for distance(s1, s2, max_dist=N) method.

branches.name: feature/multi-threaded-batch
branches.rationale: To allow faster processing of large lists of strings for similarity ranking through parallel computation.

commits.title: Implement batch_distance method
commits.body: Added a new method to compute edit distances in batches using multiple threads.
per_file_changes: Added batch_distance function for multi-threaded processing.

commits.title: Expose batch_distance in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new method in the public API.
per_file_changes: Added batch_distance to the module exports.

commits.title: Update documentation for batch_distance
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new method.

branches.name: feature/edit-operations-path
branches.rationale: To provide detailed insights into the edit operations performed during distance calculations.

commits.title: Implement distance_with_ops method
commits.body: Added a new method to output the edit operations path during distance calculations.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_ops function to track edit operations.

commits.title: Expose distance_with_ops in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new method in the public API.
per_file_changes: Added distance_with_ops to the module exports.

commits.title: Update documentation for distance_with_ops
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for the new method.

branches.name: feature/unicode-grapheme-clusters
branches.rationale: To ensure multi-codepoint characters are treated as single units in distance calculations, improving correctness.

src/Levenshtein/levenshtein_cpp.pyx: Implement grapheme support in distance calculations
src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Expose grapheme support in the API

commits.title: Implement grapheme support in distance calculations
commits.body: Added support for Unicode grapheme clusters in distance calculations.
per_file_changes: Updated distance functions to handle grapheme clusters.

commits.title: Expose grapheme support in the API
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include the new grapheme support in the public API.
per_file_changes: Added grapheme support to the module exports.

commits.title: Update documentation for grapheme support
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include usage examples and details for grapheme support.

branches.name: feature/pure-python-fallback
branches.rationale: To maintain functionality on platforms where the C extension cannot compile, enhancing portability.

src/Levenshtein/__init__.py: Update API to select fallback module

commits.title: Implement pure-Python fallback logic
commits.body: Added a fallback module to maintain functionality on platforms without C extension support.

commits.title: Update API to select fallback module
commits.body: Updated the __init__.py to include logic for selecting the fallback module.
per_file_changes: Added logic to select between C extension and pure-Python fallback.

commits.title: Update documentation for fallback module
commits.body: Updated the documentation to include details about the fallback module.
